Sugo is the second album of Finardi and contains the first piece that will add the list of pieces that become classics for the artist, " Musica Ribelle " .
From the onset, it is less crude and reactionary, the songs are more pop arrangements. " Musica Ribelle " opens the album, is a song that is musically gritty issues typical of adolescence ( " Anna is 18 years old and you feel so alone , his face is sad and does not say a word , so it is sure that no one would understand, and even if he understood some of the betray " ), such as dissatisfaction, dreams, hopes for a different future, a passion for Musica Ribelle" that will vibrate in my bones, that gets into the skin, which tells you to go out, that yells at you to change, to give up the bullshit and put you to fight "
The next great " Radio " - style country house, which extols the qualities of free radio, and it was written " to order " for Radio Popolare. Following will be rebuilt, but will lose this incomparable freshness here.
" Quasar " is a nice jazzy instrumental. " Soldi " in its disarming simplicity " But if you have no money, no money you will make " has the typical look of the rocker Finardi vintage.
" Ninnananna " anticipates some ' romantic pop vein that will develop later.
With " Sulla strada " back to rock the road with references to the first job ( "finally say goodbye to my lord " ) and the first tour.
" Voglio " has a text dreamer and optimist, with references to space issues. 
" Oggi ho imparato a volare " is another nice piece , simple as many of the best songs of our own.
" La C.I.A. " is sung in English and it should not be surprising, given that Finardi then make an entire disc sung in that language. In this case, however, the chorus is in Italian .
" La Paura Del Domani " is almost spoken, the music is in the second floor and is a much smaller piece, which closes in a somewhat ' shabby a good record.

The album is listed in the ranking of the 100 most beautiful Italian records of all time according to Rolling Stone Italy at number 27.
